First-Order Logic: ~(E z (RigidType(z) ^ Sortal(z) ^ subClassOf(x,z) ^ subClassOf(z,y))) ^ AntiRigidType(x) ^ Sortal(x) ^ subClassOf(x,y) -> ~Category(y)
Markdown: $\neg (\exists z (RigidType(z) \land Sortal(z) \land subClassOf(x,z) \land subClassOf(z,y))) \land AntiRigidType(x) \land Sortal(x) \land subClassOf(x,y) \rightarrow \neg Category(y)$
$\neg (\exists y, z (subClassOf(y,x) \land AntiRigidType(y) \land subClassOf(z,x) \land RigidType(z))) \rightarrow \neg Mixin(x)$

First-Order Logic: ~(E y,z (x != y ^ x != z ^ subClassOf(x,y) ^ subClassOf(z,y)) -> Kind(x))
~(E y, z ( y != z ^ Sortal(y) ^ Sortal(z) ^ ~shareKind(y,z) ^ (subClassOf(y,x) v shareSuperClass(x,y))) ^ (subClassOf(z,x) v shareSuperClass(x,z))) -> ~NonSortal(x)
Markdown:
$
eg (\exists y, z ( y 
eq z \land Sortal(y) \land Sortal(z) \land 
eg shareKind(y,z) \land (subClassOf(y,x) v shareSuperClass(x,y))) \land (subClassOf(z,x) v shareSuperClass(x,z))) ightarrow 
eg NonSortal(x)$
$\neg (\exists z (Phase(z) \land subClassOf(x,z) \land subClassOf(z,y))) \land Role(x) \land subClassOf(x,y) \rightarrow \neg PhaseMixin(y)$
$\neg (\exists z (Phase(z) \land subClassOf(x,z) \land subClassOf(z,y))) \land PhaseMixin(y) \land subClassOf(x,y) \rightarrow \neg Role(x)$

$
eg (\exists z (PhaseMixin(z) \land Category(y) \land subClassOf(x,y) \land 
eg isSubClassOf(x,z) \land 
eg isSubClassOf(z,x) \land isSubClassOf(z,y))) ightarrow 
eg PhaseMixin(x)$

$
eg (\exists z (PhaseMixin(z) \land PhaseMixin(x) \land subClassOf(x,y) \land 
eg isSubClassOf(x,z) \land 
eg isSubClassOf(z,x) \land isSubClassOf(z,y))) ightarrow 
eg Category(y)$

$
eg Category(x) \land 
eg Kind(x) \land 
eg SubKind(x) \land 
eg Role(x) \land 
eg Phase(x) \land 
eg RoleMixin(x) \land 
eg PhaseMixin(x) ightarrow SemiRigidType(x)$

$
eg Role(x) \land 
eg Phase(x) \land 
eg RoleMixin(x) \land 
eg PhaseMixin(x) \land 
eg Mixin(x) ightarrow RigidType(x)$

$
eg Sortal(x) ightarrow NonSortal(x) \land 
eg Kind(x) \land 
eg SubKind(x) \land 
eg Role(x) \land 
eg Phase(x)$

$
eg NonSortal(x) ightarrow Sortal(x) \land 
eg Category(x) \land 
eg PhaseMixin(x) \land 
eg RoleMixin(x) \land 
eg Mixin(x)$

$RigidType(x) ightarrow 
eg NonRigidType(x) \land 
eg AntiRigidType(x) \land 
eg SemiRigidType(x) \land 
eg Role(x) \land 
eg Phase(x) \land 
eg RoleMixin(x) \land 
eg PhaseMixin(x) \land 
eg Mixin(x)$

$AntiRigidType(x) ightarrow NonRigidType(x) \land 
eg SemiRigidType(x) \land 
eg Category(x) \land 
eg Kind(x) \land 
eg SubKind(x) \land 
eg Mixin(x)$

$SemiRigidType(x) ightarrow Mixin(x) \land NonRigidType(x) \land 
eg AntiRigidType(x) \land 
eg Category(x) \land 
eg Kind(x) \land 
eg SubKind(x) \land 
eg Role(x) \land 
eg Phase(x) \land 
eg RoleMixin(x) \land 
eg PhaseMixin(x)$

$Kind(x) ightarrow RigidType(x) \land Sortal(x) \land 
eg Category(x) \land 
eg Phase(x) \land 
eg Role(x) \land 
eg SubKind(x)$

$SubKind(x) ightarrow RigidType(x) \land Sortal(x) \land 
eg Category(x) \land 
eg Kind(x) \land 
eg Phase(x) \land 
eg Role(x)$

$Role(x) ightarrow AntiRigidType(x) \land Sortal(x) \land 
eg Kind(x) \land 
eg Phase(x) \land 
eg PhaseMixin(x) \land 
eg RoleMixin(x) \land 
eg SubKind(x)$

$Phase(x) ightarrow AntiRigidType(x) \land Sortal(x) \land 
eg Kind(x) \land 
eg PhaseMixin(x) \land 
eg Role(x) \land 
eg RoleMixin(x) \land 
eg SubKind(x) $

$Category(x) ightarrow NonSortal(x) \land RigidType(x) \land 
eg Kind(x) \land 
eg Mixin(x) \land 
eg PhaseMixin(x) \land 
eg RoleMixin(x) \land 
eg SubKind(x)$

$RoleMixin(x) ightarrow AntiRigidType(x) \land NonSortal(x) \land 
eg Category(x) \land 
eg Mixin(x) \land 
eg Phase(x) \land 
eg PhaseMixin(x) \land 
eg Role(x)$

$PhaseMixin(x) ightarrow AntiRigidType(x) \land NonSortal(x) \land 
eg Category(x) \land 
eg Mixin(x) \land 
eg Phase(x) \land 
eg Role(x) \land 
eg RoleMixin(x)$

First-Order Logic: AntiRigidType(x) ^ Sortal(x) ^ Category(y) ^ subClassOf(x,y) -> E z (RigidType(z) ^ Sortal(z) ^ subClassOf(x,z) ^ subClassOf(z,y))
Markdown: $AntiRigidType(x) \land Sortal(x) \land Category(y) \land subClassOf(x,y) \rightarrow \exists z (RigidType(z) \land Sortal(z) \land subClassOf(x,z) \land subClassOf(z,y))$

First-Order Logic: NonSortal(x) ^ Sortal(y) ^ (subClassOf(y,x) v shareSuperClass(x,y)) -> E z (y != z ^ Sortal(z) ^ ~shareKind(y,z) ^ (subClassOf(z,x) v shareSuperClass(x,z)))
Markdown: $NonSortal(x) \land Sortal(y) \land (subClassOf(y,x) \lor shareSuperClass(x,y)) \rightarrow \exists z (y \neq z \land Sortal(z) \land \neg shareKind(y,z) \land (subClassOf(z,x) \lor shareSuperClass(x,z)))$

First-Order Logic: Role(x) ^ PhaseMixin(y) ^ subClassOf(x,y) -> E z (Phase(z) ^ subClassOf(x,z) ^ subClassOf(z,y))
PhaseMixin(x) ^ Category(y) ^ subClassOf(x,y) -> E z (PhaseMixin(z) ^ ~isSubClassOf(x,z) ^ ~isSubClassOf(z,x) ^ isSubClassOf(z,y))
Markdown: $PhaseMixin(x) \land Category(y) \land subClassOf(x,y) \rightarrow \exists z (PhaseMixin(z) \land \neg isSubClassOf(x,z) \land \neg isSubClassOf(z,x) \land isSubClassOf(z,y))$
